body: Hi Hamed, Thank you for reporting the issue. Fortunately it was only a mistake in the input description. The code was written as expected: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/w9Yv73A6XmCj*Rc9co81OU8QaiMMQZ1MKCLACiFaGwKI90rWseuwUH8OqLKCOSQUWfUTg8escJrRD-5Wa9IxrS23Q8lZOhgu/CDD_HDD.JPG) The descriptions are also fixed now: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/w9Yv73A6XmBu4K0t0Lp5ISgegh9cpVzFzj1U10ra5ollOJME5Gp*2YCpBy3S-tQrhAYOf5UCS2wvqkVDxhsi41QHuGxpkPrs/description.JPG) I'm not sure if the values are also part of your discussion but Ladybug's base temperatures are selected based on [arguably] comfort temperature range and not ASHRAE. As you have probably already know you can adjust them by changing the input values. Mostapha
